executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2023 currency. Group homes provide residential and other services to individuals of differing ages and needs. Counseling services in boot camps for delinquent youths will differ from services for group homes for disabled adults or services for children in group foster care. The industry-wide need for services is related to the overall economy's health, with unemployment, drug use and societal stressors playing a significant role. Revenue is countercyclical, accelerating in troubling and trying times. In the grips of the COVID-19 pandemic, group home establishments' revenue grew, aided in no small part by the majority of establishments' nonprofit structure. With generous government assistance, industry revenue has been growing at a CAGR of 0.6% over the past five years, including a drop of 1.6% in the current year, and is expected to reach $9.9 billion in 2023, with profit hitting a new 5.5% low.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Movement Away From Group Congregate Settings Comes At A Cost
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: A shift to redesign child welfare into a system of child and family well-being is underway. Moving children into foster care from larger institutions like orphanages allows children considerable one on one interaction that will enable them to form meaningful attachments to caregivers or peers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Group settings are mostly temporary and when services are in short supply, the foster care system will be overwhelmed.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: and adding the type of care ( trauma-informed care) will keep group home employees working at the group residence, ensuring adequate capacity if government policy impacts the economy, family planning, crime and drug use.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC SHOWED HOW FEDERAL FUNDING IS CRITICAL FOR REVENUE GROWTH
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In 2020, significant percentage increases in Federal funding for social services and Federal funding for Medicare and Medicaid led to a substantial surge in revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: PROFIT TRENDS DOWNWARD DUE TO WAGE PRESSURE
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: This industry is dominated by nonprofit organizations with revenue flowing primarily from government agencies. Despite the growth in revenue stemming from COVID-19 assistance, profit declined due to the growing number of employees and the rapid surge in wages, a major component of cost.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: SERVICE PROVIDERS ARE A POTENTIAL ADDITIONAL ROLE FOR GROUP HOME EMPLOYEES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Policymakers and professionals are working to move children out of group foster homes or large institutions to more permanent living foster home situations, preferably with a family member, since it is better for the children.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: EVIDENCE SHOWS NONPROFIT IS THE DIRECTION FOR MOST ENTRANTS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The number of enterprises and establishments is expected to climb while revenue will retreat.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: LOCALIZED NEEDS KEEP GROUP HOMES SMALL, BUT THE ORGANIZATION CAN BE LARGE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Organizations typically serve and build a reputation and relationships with community members, which will aid entrants looking to go the profit route.

industry_definition: This industry includes group foster homes, group homes, halfway homes, orphanages and boot camps. The industry does not include substance abuse facilities, retirement homes, correctional institutions or temporary shelters. While the industry provides some services to adults, these facilities are primarily for children and youth.

opportunities: Federal funding for Medicare and Medicaid

key_trends: Government policy inspires consolidation. The trend to move children out of group settings in favor of family residences will stall entry and spur strategic exit acquisitions.
Wages eat profit for lunch. Competition for skilled employees in dense urban locations raises wage costs and reduces profit for many smaller nonprofit group homes.
Group home services providers have many federal funding and grant program options.
Established regulations reduce the number of group homes.
Services are as diverse as the residents.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Infants to five-year-old children make up one of the primary markets for this industry.
Children between the ages of 6 and 15 are the largest market for this industry.
Adolescents aged 16 to 18 are a small industry market.
Young adults aged 19 and older may live in group homes for hearing or visually-impaired individuals.

products_and_services.product_description: Residential facilities that provide counseling services.
Private and government contributions make up more than one-third of revenue.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Residential Facilities without Counseling or Rehabilitation
products_and_services.product_description: Residential facilities that do not provide counseling or rehabilitation services.
Residential facilities that provide other services besides counseling.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Other Services Including for Elderly and Disabled
products_and_services.product_description: Other services provided, including services for the elderly and disabled.

tier_1_suppliers: Toy & Craft Supplies Wholesaling in the US
Supermarkets & Grocery Stores in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Generic Pharmaceutical Manufacturing in the US
Apartment & Condominium Construction in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: In-Residence is the Unifying Service Among the Plentiful Services
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Many group homes provide support and resources for their residents.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Contributions are Essential for Residential Group Providers
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Private and government contributions make up more than one-third of revenue.

business_locations.location: The Most Populated States, with Large Urban Areas
business_locations.location_description: The most populated states, with large urban areas, have the most locations.

regulations_points.regulation_title: ADOPTION AND SAFE FAMILIES ACT (ASFA) OF 1997
regulations_points.regulation_description: ASFA set rules for states regarding the timely permanent placement of children in foster care including adoption.
ADA prohibited discrimination against individuals with disabilities.

regulations_points.regulation_title: HEALTH INSURANCE PORTABILITY AND ACCOUNTABILITY ACT (HIPAA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: HIPAA set standards for protecting the privacy and security of individuals' health information.

regulations_points.regulation_title: TITLE IV-E OF THE SOCIAL SECURITY ACT
regulations_points.regulation_description: Title IV-E governed the federal funding to states for foster care and adoption assistance.
ICWA governed the placement and set standards for American Indian and Alaska Native children.

regulations_points.regulation_title: FOSTERING CONNECTIONS TO SUCCESS AND INCREASING ADOPTIONS ACT (2008)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The goal of this act was to place children in foster homes with relatives.

regulations_points.regulation_title: MEDICAID AND THE PATIENT PROTECTION AND AFFORDABLE CARE ACT (PPACA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: Foster homes receive Medicaid aid for children's healthcare costs.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE FAMILY FIRST PREVENTION SERVICES ACT (FFPSA) 2018
regulations_points.regulation_description: FFPSA plays a role in reducing congregate care in favor of family-like settings.

basis_points.basis_description: The government takes the lead role in lessening concentration.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Group Home Providers Face a "Smaller is Better" Trend
concentration_points.concentration_description: Children enter group foster care for various reasons.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Government Policies Enforce That Smaller is Better
concentration_points.concentration_description: Government grants and programs have encouraged community-based alternatives.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: WAGES ARE RISING AND TEARING INTO REVENUE
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Like other service industries, wage costs are expected to account for 55.0% of revenue in 2023.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: MARKETING EXPENSES ARE MINIMAL, BUT CRUCIAL
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Marketing accounts for an estimated 0.4% of revenue in 2023.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Group homes must hire skilled employees.
The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Significant Shifts in Funding Promote Swings in Revenue
volatility_points.volatility_description: Federal funding can lead to a divergence between those needing services and those able to take advantage of residential services.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Economic and Social Policy Initiatives Set a Trajectory for Reduced Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Funding increases the number of individuals that qualify for service.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: In-Residence is the Unifying Service Among the Plentiful Services
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Many group homes provide support and resources for their residents.

FAQs.question: Has increased federal funding offered opportunities for your company?
FAQs.answer: Federal funding has helped the majority of operators as the majority of enterprises are non-profits.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your revenue comes from government funding?
FAQs.answer: Federal funding for social services is the primary source of this industry's revenue.
